revised_title: Observations of Two Unusual Aurorae Boreales
tldr: The author describes two instances of unusual aurorae boreales observed in Oxford, one in February 1769 and another in September 1769. The first event showed a gradual shift from a typical aurora borealis to a rare aurora australis, while the second event displayed a red, fiery appearance in the sky. These observations provide valuable insights into the atmospheric conditions and celestial phenomena of the time.
